Description: Rounded arsenical copper axe-head with two lugs and three drilled binding-holes that are regularly positioned. The butt is slightly convex. It is quite thickly corroded, especially on the sides and at the cutting end. To judge from the little of it that may be seen, the edge was never fully sharpened.
Bibliographic references: Davies 1987 / Catalogue of Egyptian Antiquities in the British Museum (56)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Sir Henry Solomon Wellcome
